alert.note: Alert for Evans; Liberty; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 11:52PM EDT until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan, Bulloch, Candler, Evans, Liberty, Long and Tattnall. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated only very light showers moving across interior Southeast Georgia in the wake of Tropical Idalia. While additional flooding is unlikely, flooding continues in many areas. Emergency Management officials report roads are still closed in some areas. Never drive into areas where waters covers the road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Statesboro, Reidsville, Metter, Glennville, Claxton, Brooklet, Hagan, Collins, Cobbtown, Pulaski, Register, Daisy, Bellville, Manassas, Mendes, Groveland, Nevils, Gordonia Altamaha State Park, Denmark and Georgia Southern.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
